text: "Improvements" to Stage Manager are announced
full-pick-text: "Improvements" to Stage Manager are announced

text: 2 sizes of iMac announced
full-pick-text: 2 sizes of iMac announced
notes: • An iMac even being announced was fairly risky. However, it came in just one size.

text: 2017 will see a more powerful iMac at the top of the line that rivals and replaces the Mac Pro
full-pick-text: 2017 will see a more powerful iMac at the top of the line that rivals and replaces the Mac Pro. The Mac Pro will go away, the Mac Mini also goes away, by the end of 2017 the iMac is all that remains.
notes:
• "The Mac Pro will go away, the Mac Mini also goes away, by the end of 2017 the iMac is all that remains."
  • While explaining, Myke got a little carried away with how complete this transition would be, but when challenged to make it part of the pick, he decided to go for it.

text: 5G becomes an option on at least one MacBook
full-pick-text: 5G becomes an option on at least one MacBook

text: A CPU transition is announced for the Mac
full-pick-text: A CPU transition is announced for the Mac
notes: • Federico counsels against specifying ARM, which is good because Apple calls it "Apple Silicon" and never uses the term ARM.

text: A desktop Apple Silicon Mac is announced
full-pick-text: A desktop Apple Silicon Mac is announced
notes: • This pick literally came to Stephen in a dream, in which Tim Cook announced the Mac mini as a "bad little b****".

text: A Mac gets a screen that supports touch and/or Apple Pencil input
full-pick-text: A Mac gets a screen that supports touch and/or Apple Pencil input
notes: • Myke was torn between this and "iPad multitasking is overhauled again", but elected to make the more passionate pick.

text: A more powerful Mac Mini is announced, but it is not a "Mac Mini Pro"
full-pick-text: A more powerful Mac Mini is announced, but it is not a "Mac Mini Pro"
notes:
• The Mac Studio is very close, but this pick was about the name and the Mac Studio, while very reminiscent of the Mini, is not named as such.
  • Just 2 weeks after the grading window closed, the M2 Pro Mac mini was announced.

text: A new base model Mac mini is introduced with the M2 chip...
full-pick-text: A new base model Mac mini is introduced with the M2 chip. The new Mini is at least 30% smaller than the current one. It's thicker, but narrower, making it more similar to an Apple TV or Intel NUC.
notes:
• "... The new Mini is at least 30% smaller than the current one. It's thicker, but narrower, making it more similar to an Apple TV or Intel NUC."
  • In other words, closer to a cubic shape, but not necessarily a cube. Although Federico loves cubes, so that would be great.
  • The base model would get updated the next year, but it's the same shape.

text: A new iMac has adjustability that is reminiscent of the Pro Display XDR
full-pick-text: A new iMac has adjustability that is reminiscent of the Pro Display XDR

text: A new iMac is announced with Intel CPUs
full-pick-text: A new iMac is announced with Intel CPUs
notes: • While it could still happen, as of 2022 the Apple Silicon transition appears to be complete for the iMac with no last Intel version.

text: A new MacBook comes with at least one new non-USB-C/Thunderbolt port on the laptop itself
full-pick-text: A new MacBook comes with at least one new non-USB-C/Thunderbolt port on the laptop itself

text: A revised 13" MBP drops the Touch Bar but does not add MagSafe
full-pick-text: A revised 13" MBP drops the Touch Bar but does not add MagSafe

text: An Apple Silicon Mac is available to order in November 2020
full-pick-text: An Apple Silicon Mac is available to order in November 2020

text: An Apple Silicon Mac is cheaper than the product it replaces
full-pick-text: An Apple Silicon Mac is cheaper than the product it replaces

full-pick-text: An iMac Pro is unveiled

text: Any kind of release timeframe is provided for macOS Monterey
full-pick-text: Any kind of release timeframe is provided for macOS Monterey
notes: • Apparently feeling humble, Federico admits that this is a "boring" pick. It was originally "release date", but when some questioning about whether just a month would count came up, he watered it down.

text: Apple announces a Mac mini that is more performant than the original M1 model
full-pick-text: Apple announces a Mac mini that is more performant than the original M1 model
notes: • Stephen returns to the Mac mini, since it served him very well last year.

text: Apple announces a new Apple Silicon system-on-a-chip
full-pick-text: Apple announces a new Apple Silicon system-on-a-chip

full-pick-text: Apple announces a new Mac Pro powered by Apple Silicon

full-pick-text: Apple announces the first M2 Mac

text: Apple announces Windows for ARM coming via virtualization in the future
full-pick-text: Apple announces Windows for ARM coming via virtualization in the future
notes: • Parallels was updated to do this by 2021, but it wasn't announced at this event.

text: Apple compares the performance of Apple Silicon Macs to "most PCs sold today"
full-pick-text: Apple compares the performance of Apple Silicon Macs to "most PCs sold today"

text: Apple demos a game running on an Apple Silicon Mac
full-pick-text: Apple demos a game running on an Apple Silicon Mac

text: Apple demos a Mac app that takes advantage of the updated Neural Engine
full-pick-text: Apple demos a Mac app that takes advantage of the updated Neural Engine

text: Apple demos iOS apps running on a Mac
full-pick-text: Apple demos iOS apps running on a Mac

text: Apple gives a sneak peak of the new Mac Pro...
full-pick-text: Apple gives a sneak peak of the new Mac Pro. It features a case design inspired by the 2019 Mac Pro. It features more ports than any other Apple Silicon Mac available today. It does not have support for third-party GPUs. It features a chip name that has not appeared in any other product. It has a starting price of at least $6,999. It is coming later this year.
notes:
• "...It features a case design inspired by the 2019 Mac Pro. It features more ports than any other Apple Silicon Mac available today. It does not have support for third-party GPUs. It features a chip name that has not appeared in any other product. It has a starting price of at least $6,999. It is coming later this year."
  • Originally it said "same case design", but the change was accepted on air after Myke reconsidered. "Later this year" was also demoted from being an exact quote.
  • This Mac Pro will have to beat the Mac Studio in terms of ports: 2 USB-C, 2 USB-A, 4 Thunderbolt, SD card, Ethernet, HDMI, and headphone jack, for a total of 12.
  • This pick is similar in spirit to Myke's ongoing Annual pick, but with different conditions. At the time it was the most complex graded pick ever made.

text: Apple has Apple Silicon versions of all of its Intel Macs on sale by the end of 2021
full-pick-text: Apple has Apple Silicon versions of all of its Intel Macs on sale by the end of 2021
notes:
• "No Intel Macs are available for sale without an Apple Silicon counterpart." Myke points out the iMac Pro as a potential spoiler.
  • (For pick complexity purposes, I'm counting this as 1 condition for each Mac line that still had no Apple Silicon counterpart at the beginning of 2021: The larger MacBook Pros, the iMac in both sizes, the iMac Pro, and the Mac Pro. The Mac mini is 1 line with a high end and low end, so it already had an "Apple Silicon counterpart" although the high end Mac mini was still Intel.)
  • The iMac Pro left the lineup entirely, but the Mac Pro remained on Intel for about a year and a half more.

text: Apple introduces a new Mac mini with an updated design
full-pick-text: Apple introduces a new Mac mini with an updated design
notes: • Myke insists, and Federico seems to agree, that even a change in the ports on the back is "an updated design". Stephen seems less convinced, but that's a matter for grading. It's agreed that it has to be the Mac itself and not, say, an accessory or power cord.

text: Apple redesigns the App Store app for Mac to include iOS, macOS, and iPadOS apps together
full-pick-text: Apple redesigns the App Store app for Mac to include iOS, macOS, and iPadOS apps together

text: Apple releases a larger MacBook Air
full-pick-text: Apple releases a larger MacBook Air
notes: • Just before the grading of this pick, hummonizing with Stephen's bell met an inglorious end, as it seemed to stop working and also Myke was kind of done with it.

text: Apple releases a new Mac mini
full-pick-text: Apple releases a new Mac mini
notes: • Ungraded: Probably the same design but with an M2 chip. More Thunderbolt ports would be nice.

text: Apple releases a new MacBook Air that comes with some colour options not previously available in this product line
full-pick-text: Apple releases a new MacBook Air that comes with some colour options not previously available in this product line
notes:
• It got Midnight and Starlight.
  • This is the beginning of an increasingly musical accompaniment to Stephen's "correct" bell, to accommodate Zoom's echo cancellation.

text: Apple releases an iMac with a larger screen
full-pick-text: Apple releases an iMac with a larger screen

text: Apple releases at least 2 different Mac models that run on Apple Silicon
full-pick-text: Apple releases at least 2 different Mac models that run on Apple Silicon

text: Apple releases new developer APIs for Stage Manager
full-pick-text: Apple releases new developer APIs for Stage Manager
notes: • At the time of picking there were not any developer APIs for Stage Manager on either macOS or iPadOS, so anything will be "new".

text: Apple replaces at least one bundled macOS app with a Marzipan version
full-pick-text: Apple replaces at least one bundled macOS app with a Marzipan version
notes:
• It's called Catalyst, not Marzipan, which is pushed back on a little. Podcasts is cited as fulfilling this (is it replacing a Mac app? Stephen gets away with this a bit) and they say that Messages might now be a Catalyst app, but in fact it isn't.
  • The permissive grading may be due to the other hosts not wanting to get too picky when it comes to grading later picks.

text: Apple teases another Mac, that is not for sale right now, with Pro in the name, and says that it is coming next year
full-pick-text: Apple teases another Mac, that is not for sale right now, with Pro in the name, and says that it is coming next year
notes: • It was originally "Mac product", but there was some controversy over whether that includes accessories and displays. Ultimately, Myke upped the difficulty and removed the word "product".

full-pick-text: Apple unveils a new MacBook Pro

full-pick-text: Apple unveils an iMac Pro
